meanings.definition: The process of breaking down a polymer into its constituent monomers.
meanings.sent1: During depolymerization, the long plastic chain is broken into smaller pieces.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study depolymerization to understand how to recycle plastics effectively.
meanings.sent3: At the toy factory, the machine went haywire, causing depolymerization of all the plastic parts!
meanings.sent4: The depolymerization of the giant rubber band turned it into tiny rubber rings.
meanings.sent5: In the lab, the students witnessed the depolymerization of the colorful slime, revealing its basic components.

meanings.definition: The reverse of polymerization, involving the breakdown of a polymer into smaller units.
meanings.sent1: The factory uses depolymerization to break down old plastic bottles for recycling.
meanings.sent2: Depolymerization is essential in the process of converting used tires into new materials.
meanings.sent3: During the science experiment, the accidental depolymerization of the rubber band caused a hilarious mess.
meanings.sent4: The depolymerization of the plastic cup transformed it into tiny plastic beads.
meanings.sent5: The depolymerization of the rubber tire revealed the individual components that make up its structure.
